I wore it with black high heel knee boots and cashmere coat one night. And with these booties to the baby shower. Hate to send it back! Pretty fabric. The sleeve makes it special.

Kate Spade never disappoints! Loved everything about this dress. Great year round in all climates. I wore it in winter weather with a pair of thermal tights, but could totally see myself wearing it in the summer with some wedge sandals!

links_reviews_title: It's so hard to say goodbye
links_reviews_text: The name of this dress is inappropriately named wallflower. It was the most complimented dress I've worn in months! Didn't matter where, at work, in line for Mexican food it was noticed by men women and children. So much fun, don't miss out on this cutie!
I loved this dress because it was lightweight and had a fun style. EVERYONE else loved this dress because it was gorgeous and classy and cute. So bold though. Not your "everyday" pattern for sure.

I wore this to Churchill Downs for the horse racing on Thanksgiving Day. Bright and cheery,...it also has ruching in the back that makes it a comfortable fit. I will definitely wear it one more time before sending it back. Would consider buying it if it wasn't so spendy. Why buy when you can rent.? Love RTR.

Very pretty - kind of a lot of pink for my taste but a nice rental for work, Thanksgiving dinner, the Nutcracker. Length is on the shorter side by the high neck balances it. True to size and only fitted at the waist, which is sort of a high waist fitting more around the lower rib cage and flaring out from there. The skirt is full and the back from the waist up is smocked and totally stretchy, so it would be forgiving for a larger bust or hips.

This print was super cute for winter with black tights. The gathering on the upper back of the dress made the front fit perfect. It hit above the knee, so it was a little short, but the cute bell sleeves and swinging fit made it fun to wear.
It's not the most flattering cut on a curved frame but the beautiful print and color make up for it. Doesn't wrinkle - added bonus.
So comfortable and light. The back smocking makes it fit perfectly and the details and print are perfection! I want to wear this every day!
This was a fun dress. Kate Spade rarely disappoints! 6 fit great.

links_reviews_title: Wonderful fit and great for holidays!
links_reviews_text: Loose fit, but flattering at the top. Fun sleeves and good length for church or work.
I rented this dress as a perfect transition between winter and spring. I am 5'7" and it was a little shorter than I was hoping. But super cute if you are shorter than me.
Very nice fit, relaxed. Stretchy material on the back. 70s style flower pattern
This dress is fun and flattering and quite conservative making it a great dress for a party, the office or a work conference. It's super comfortable and I love the pattern!
No Cons
Did not wear
Fit TTS, ruching in the back makes for a perfect torso fit. The fabric is gorgeous. I wore this for a big work presentation and felt like a star.

Rented with my unlimited and was another Kate Spade success. I am a 0/2 petite straight figure and this created curves and was super flattering. Loved the print and the sleeves. Perfect length for me as well. Wore with black tights and heeled closed toe black mules. Got tons of compliments. And best part is that with the smocking on the back, it was fitted but still comfortable to wear all day.
This is a very cute dress but too short for my 5'10 height. The back was right under my butt.
I rented this as an option for Valentines Day. It was a little frumpy for that occasion. Would be a great work dress. Good fit and comfortable. Did not actually wear out.
Fit well but snug in chest. Soft and feminine.
Such a flattering and easy fit! Very versatile, wore it to church and a work dinner.
I normally have two size up in blazers, but this one I could have gone my usual size. You can see it was a little large.
Lighter weight fabric is great for spring and early summer. Nice lining, too. Very well made. Quality.

This blazer is amazing! I feel like I can take on the world in it. I knew that I would love it when I saw it on the rack. I wish that I could buy it. But I am going to keep it to wear at least one more time. If you like well made blazers, this one is for you!

links_reviews_title: Fun pattern, great material for lounging or heading out
links_reviews_text: Rented this as a set to wear while working from home and looking presentable on camera for work calls and filming. Felt chic and cute and not overdressed for the situation!
Got these for working at home during the COVID19 Quarantine. Pants were very comfortable and even had pockets.
Thank goodness for pants like this while working from home! They were so comfortable, Albeit very pajama like. I do wish I had sizes down.
Too short and too tight. Wasn't a fan of this at all. Came new with tags and I didn't even wear it.
The pants kept sliding down. They were comfortable.
Legs a bit too narrow for the pajama look.
I was so excited to add these to my WFH sleek comfort wear, but the elastic band and layers of material make for an uncomfortable pouch looking stomach versus lightweight comfort I was hoping for.
I think I'm a little to curvy for the bottoms. The top fit well though.

links_reviews_title: Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur...
links_reviews_text: The softest sweater EVER. So cosy and warm!! The medium fit me perfectly. You should be aware that the slits on each side are rather high, so you need to pair with high rise jeans or an undershirt. Also, mr coworker said I looked like Nancy Drew at a ski resort. LOVED!

links_reviews_title: Cute from the front weird from the back
links_reviews_text: It almost didn't feel natural to tie the tie in the front or the back. It was cute to tie the tie in the front but then it looked weird from the back and vice verse. Still cute and very comfortable just not my favorite

There are skits up the side so I wore a tank top underneath (although a thin, tight long sleeve shirt would have worked too if it had been colder out). Soft knit. Warm but not too hot. I was worried the tie in the front would look bulky but it was fine. Interesting cut/shape.

I LOVED this sweater. So cute and chic, but also comfy and not itchy. The slits on the side were super cute and the sleeves were a little short, but purposefully short so it looked cute. I really loved this sweater!

This sweater is soft, medium grey, and comfortable. I wore a black turtleneck underneath because I felt it was a little itchy without it. The sleeves are a tad short. There's nothing special about the sweater.

Overall this was a great sweater. It has slits on the side which were cool except I didn't have a great tank to wear under. Because of the wool, my cotton tanks kept riding up. I was adjusting the tank constantly to keep my skin from showing.

links_reviews_title: This piece is a nice casual sweater to add to a wardrobe
links_reviews_text: This specific piece is very warn, it should be retired or sold at a major discount once I return it.

links_reviews_title: Slits up to your bra line
links_reviews_text: I don't know if the picture on RTR is no correct or this shrunk but the slits on the side we're up to my bra line and I'm 5'5" 150lbs and rented a medium. Couldn't wear
Slits were a little high on the side. Wore a tank top under and it was fine
The sleeve length was a little weird but overall a really cute and flattering sweater!
Cute sweater, I liked the tie in the front a lot. The side slits were a little high though so I wore a tank top under it.

I wore this three times the week I had it -- it's cozy and cute. It runs a little big -- but also meant to be blousy, I think. I wore it with high waisted leggings with no tank, and with normal rise leggings with a tank (it does have high side slits)

links_reviews_title: Adorable sweater, loved the fit, didn't wear because it was worn
links_reviews_text: The sweater is adorable and I love the fit (very flattering). I didn't wear the sweater unfortunately because it was very worn looking/pilly

links_reviews_title: This looked very casual. No compliments since it wasn’t that kind of party!
links_reviews_text: This piece is very worn out looking but I liked that it looked like piece from my own closet that I just pulled out after a long time.

links_reviews_title: Unique belted style adds flair to a versatile grey turtleneck
links_reviews_text: Very useful for lots of outfits, but the fabric has a bunch of pilling. I shaved it with my sweater shaver, but the pills would not be tamed. Seems a little over worn. I liked it enough to wear twice.
Cute top! The sides are split open a bit so you may need to wear high waisted pants or a tank top underneath to avoid showing skin if this is a work shirt.
Super cute and comfortable and flattering! I loved it.
I wore this sweater both casually and to work. The tie makes the casual sweater more structured and more professional. My only complaint is that the sweater was super pilly and seemed over worn.

I wore this piece for work. It was really cute, but because the side openings went up so high I ended up having to wear a shirt underneath, which I wasn't expecting and ended up making it feel a little awkward. Comfortable, but fabric is a little bit thin/light for a sweater. It has more of a wooly blouse feel.

I wore this sweater to work today and it was perfect for a chilly office. It's very soft and not itchy at all. I did have to wear a tank/camisole underneath because of the peakaboo slits on the sides. With a pair of high-waisted jeans though, and not at work, it would be perfect. Sweater was brand new when it arrived. Still with original tags! This might be a keeper.

links_reviews_title: Great fit, just a bit of skin. Comfortable but pulled together and classy. A lot of fun to wear!
links_reviews_text: Paired with black skinny jeans and booties. Felt sexy but classic.
Pretty sweater, lots of compliments, I found the belt awkward and wished the sweater was a little longer

I loved this top, the tie detail is super flattering. Definitely cinched in my waist. It was also very classy, soft, and warm! The loose fit sleeves are perfect for the office when it might be cold outside but the heat is blasting indoors.

links_reviews_title: this is a fun weekend sweater - cute with white jeans!
links_reviews_text: great quality - the open sides are super fun. I like that the belt is only in the front. great dark grey color...would get again!
Love this sweater. The fit is comfortable, and you can make it tighter at the waist with the bow. I thought it was black but it is actually dark grey. love the sleeve cut too

I loved the material of this sweater, it was super soft and cozy! The only thing I found a little awkward about this sweater was the tie front. No matter how I tied it, it did not seem to look right. Because of this, I ended up tucking in the two fabric pieces into my waist band.
Comfy, unique, a little scratchy but worth it. Loose style.
Runs large. I could've sized down. Pretty pink color!
I really like this little top. Bright and cheery. I wore it for my big outing to the grocery store.

links_reviews_title: The coat came with a missing button and a brown stain on the inside
links_reviews_text: I don't think I will be wearing this out. I will be returning this item with the rest of my pieces which I do enjoy
I loved how versatile this jacket was and I found myself grabbing it every morning.
I wanted to love this but the fabric, color, and wrap scream bathrobe once on. So cute in pictures but in person you look like you're running out to get the mail in a nice robe.

I wore this out on a date, and I wasn't totally smitten with the fit. I have average/wide shoulders, and the shoulder seam was *just* too narrow, but the waist was very wide. The belt is connected, so I couldn't shift it around to make the robe-like fit more flattering. I could wrap the jacket around me from side to side - lots of roomy material. It would poof around my butt if tight in the waist, or make me look huge if tied looser. It's very soft and has pockets (Yay!), but is unlined so NOT good for cold weather, better for mild fall or spring temps.
I loved this coat and will definitely rent again once the temperature goes up a bit. It's a little lighter than a winter coat so it's perfect for the in between seasons.
Very soft material and actually kept me warm, but runs large. I'm a 6 and the medium was too big I couldn't button the coat properly. The tie waistband definitely helped.
Loved this jacket, great for making a statement everyday. Stunning From the office to date night

I loved this coat! The only problem is I got it too late in the season so it wasn't cold enough to keep it and wear it several more times. My only mistake was sizing up since it was a coat. I should have stuck with my usually size large because the xl was too big. Such a classy coat.

links_reviews_title: Sized down and still didn't fit
links_reviews_text: I'm normally a medium, should have done an extra small. The small was still absurdly big.
Not flattering, felt like I was wearing a robe

links_reviews_title: Love this jacket considering buying it
links_reviews_text: Love this jacket, lightweight but warm. Perfect jacket
Cute

links_reviews_title: Absolutely love the look and feel of this coat.

Excellent fit and quality stitching and fabric. Received multiple compliments and am considering keeping because I just can't bear to part with it.

links_reviews_title: Easy everyday coat, perfect for work
links_reviews_text: Loved the color, the coat was big on me but the tie helped a lot.

links_reviews_title: Added a touch of class and professionalism to my work event.
links_reviews_text: This coat is huge! Initially I didn't like it--I looked like a child playing dress-up. Eventually it grew on me and I ended up really liking it. Got a ton of compliments too.
It fits perfect! Wore multiple times will be renting again!
Warm, very warm but the color is a pale grey, not the bluish grey that it looked on my screen. Not a big deal for me, though.
Nice light dress jacket. The sizing told me to get a XL but I should have gotten a L. Too big, but I still wore it!
I loved the casual elegance of this coat - it was easy to dress up or down and fit perfectly, you could size up if you want a looser fit for bulky winter sweaters but otherwise found it true to size
Ordered a larger size but lo e the color and texture. On trend and great length. Will still wear as oversized coats at so in :)

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous coat. I rented for Thanksgiving in Chicago. Kept me warm in 30-40 degree weather.
links_reviews_text: It definitely runs large, but it was easy to layer under the coat.

links_reviews_title: Runs very large, but beautiful material!
links_reviews_text: I guess I was the first to order this beautiful looking coat to try on--and it truly is beautiful in the material and general look. Unfortunately, it absolutely swamped me, and I ordered my usual size. I could probably go down to an XS. That said, the cut in the image looks a lot less boxy than it ends up being--it's kind of robe-like, so it would be gorgeous on tall slender women, but doesn't have enough structure to look nice on my short curves. Maybe I'll try again in the XS sometime, but for now hopefully some tall slender woman will get to enjoy!

links_reviews_title: The colors and pattern on this dress are beautiful. It's also very comfortable to wear.
links_reviews_text: The fit is true to size. I'm pretty petite but the length was perfect. I also love the colors of this dress. It's difficult to see in the picture but the pattern and colors are beautiful and vibrant. I also enjoyed this dress because it's comfortable.

links_reviews_title: Such a fun and easy dress
links_reviews_text: I love DVF! You can probably size down for a more fitted (and shorter) look. Pretty design and soft fabric. Excellent work dress.

I adore this dress and the fit is perfect. The fabric is comfortable, the colors are lovely, and I cannot wait to wear it in warm weather. I especially love that, like the photo with the model shows, the hem of the dress hits just below the knee, which I think is really flattering on pretty much anyone's legs. If the discount were better I would buy it.

links_reviews_title: So cute. Got the S but XS might fit. Fit of DVF wrap dresses vary, esp. in the chest and shoulders.
links_reviews_text: I rented to wear to work but it's too nice for work from home. I look forward to (hopefully!) wearing this to the office in the summer. Great new addition to the DVF offerings on RTR.

links_reviews_title: DVF wrap dresses are always on point!
links_reviews_text: Once again the DVF wrap dress is a win. I always have to wear a cami underneath but other than that the dress is on point.

links_reviews_title: Size down for the best fit
links_reviews_text: These may not be the most flattering pants, but love the stretch. Size down with DVF pants like this. The waist is high and they seem to have more room. If you want them to be fitted, go one size down.

links_reviews_title: Great fit at first, but stretches throughout. the day.
links_reviews_text: I really loved these pants for the first few hours that I wore them. The material feels like quality and the pattern is fantastic. I did receive a lot of compliments while wearing. these. However, by the end of the day they were loose in the butt and knees.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable + stretchy but not the most flattering
links_reviews_text: Super comfortable pants but I wouldn't pick them for when I want to look my "best". Probably won't rent again.
Size down for sure!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful comfortable pants that stretched out
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to wear these pants more as they were so comfortable. Unfortunately, they stretched out while wearing the first time and looked unflattering by the afternoon!!
These pants are my favorite. I honestly don't want to return them. They fit well, very flattering and give great shape. Also super comfy and very classy!

links_reviews_title: Great pants. This size fit really well

links_reviews_text: Was a little large in the legs.
I live high waisted pants but usually struggle to find ones that fit my curvy hips/butt and my smaller waist. These pants ended up working perfectly. Got lots of compliments on them at work.
Too big, not flattering.

links_reviews_title: Flattering lines. Fun pattern! Perfect for work.
links_reviews_text: Really liked the pants. I am short-waisted and these pants have a very high rise, so they weren’t perfect for my body type, but they were cute with a black sweater over them. The print was both funky and classy and they were fun to wear to work. I got lots of compliments!

links_reviews_title: Great print- too big on me.

links_reviews_text: These pants did not look good on me at all. I think they are better suited for a long and lean body type. They were loose in the waist and kind of saggy in the crotch but then fitted on my butt and thighs and then loose from the knee down and a little too long. Really nice quality and cute pants, just not flattering for my body type.
I loved the high waist and skinny leg. I would size down. The waist was a little loose. And as the day went on, the pants became even looser on me.

links_reviews_title: I wore them to work a few times. Fun print, easy to match with solid colored shirts!
links_reviews_text: They fit a little larger than a normal 6R fits me and they are extremely high waisted. A legging fit through out thighs.
Loved these pants. Would buy if they were not so pricey. Very high quality I wore multiple times for work. The only con is no pockets or belt loops.
These run TTS and fit great. No issues with length (I'm only 5'3" and they weren't too long). Loved the print and got lots of compliments

I recommended sizing down in these pants. The fabric is a gorgeous pattern and thick, but it seemed to stretch over the course of the day. I rented the 6R and they started to look "saggy" by the end of the day. I will likely rent again, but will size down to a 4.

Fit of these pants was a little off for me. They were thicker than I had imagined, not as fitted at the bottom as I would have expected, and were not the most flattering for my body shape. However, still a super cute and unique pattern, very comfy, and paired nicely with another top I had rented.

I was so excited to try these pants, however with my shorter frame 5'2" the pants came up far beyond my belly button. Too high on the waist for a comfortable fit. Material is so comfy! If you're 5'4 or up I imagine these would be great pants for work or weekend!
I loved these pants. They look stylish and professional but feel like sweatpants. The pants were stretchy but fitted at the same time.

The material is thick and rich - thicker than a typical DVF dress. These pants are high waisted and look best with a bodysuit. Very sexy and elegant. My husband absolutely loves them. I will be using them for a work meeting this week.
Great pants

Rented a size 2, thinking it'd fit like my other DVF items. The fabric is a knit, and it clung to me like leggings EXCEPT for the ankle which was looser. I'd suggest sizing up from your normal DVF size if you want it to fit like trousers, regular size for leggings/pixie cut

This is my first time trying Italian sizing, so I went with something flowy. I decided to size down and it fit really well. It was fitted around the hips and then flowy where it was supposed to be. It was a little bit less formal than I thought it was going to be because the body is a thick stretchy cotton. I got a lot of compliments and I liked that the sleeves were very different and unique. I would definitely recommend this rental!

Took a chance on this one and liked it more than I thought! The lace/poplin sleeves hold their shape well even when stuffed under a jacket. The body is basically a cotton T-shirt, so the two together make a fun elevated casual look. I will say it runs large at the busy but smaller at the hips. The L fit my hips but definitely was baggy up top. The dark color helps to hide it, though.

links_reviews_title: The details are beautiful but the fabric is meh
links_reviews_text: It's a little too stiff to fall properly so the sleeves get kind of angular. Steaming may help but for a casual top that felt like a lot of effort.

The top is high quality, beautiful fabric that is soft but structured without being heavy, and the detailing in the sleeves is absolutely gorgeous. It makes a statement without trying too hard. I am pear shaped and I liked the tiny bit of fittedness around my hips. I want to buy this top and shop this designer.
Not made for curvy girls. Was a very weird design that looks great on the model in the photos. Took a chance in renting and wasn't pleased with this look at all!

links_reviews_title: My fiancé said it looks like I'm wearing a kite
links_reviews_text: Huge. Wayyy too big. I get what they're trying to go for, but be warned - everything about this is HUGE! Pretty detailing on the sleeves though.

When I showed my sister my dress for my Valentine's Day dinner date - she told me I looked like Danielle Bernstein (of WeWoreWhat). That made me feel like I made the right dress choice. It was perfectly sexy and conservative for my taste. The skirt part of the dress has a nice overlay you can't see in the photo. It goes low enough in the front, but is still covered. True to size, elastic waistband allows for a comfortable fit.

Oversized on top with exaggerated shoulders. The fringey detail is cool but I don't think the dress was a flattering shape on me. I would size down next time. The fabric is thin and overall it didn't feel particularly special to me.
Fun, flirty dress. It's a little short, but not obscene.
This puffs out a little at the waist, but the color and design were great. Overall flattering. I wore with leggings and booties.
Dress fit true to size (it's meant to be a little loose fitting on top). Cute style and pattern. Got tons of compliments. If you wanted to put a belt with it you could... loved it.

links_reviews_title: Fantastic blouse, shoulder cut outs are perfect, falls on the arm beautifully!
links_reviews_text: Great materials, perfect blouse!

Fit ok everywhere but the shoulders, where it pulled on the back openings in an unflattering way. Definitely best if you have naturally narrow shoulder line.

I thought this was a unique take on a basic white button down. However it is quite sheer and you can see the straps in the cut outs if I wore I tank underneath. I also wasn't able to tuck the shirt in because of the side slits. Untucked it hang in an unflattering way.

I did not realize that these pants had a bit of sparkle on the side of them when I first got them. It was a nice surprise, the stripe is sparkly! They fit true to size and are comfy, they are cuffed on the bottom too. I really like these would buy if not so expensive.
Great to WFH but would be cuter with matching pullover. A little worn by now..

links_reviews_title: Tight In the butt if that's your thing
links_reviews_text: Did not feel flattering.
Cute but order size down as the stretch though the day
Comfy and cozy and very unexpected for a travel day. Print is more of a beige/grey than a black and white. Would be fun loungewear first a girls trip or at a creative office.

links_reviews_title: A must rent! Super light and comfortable

links_reviews_text: This 2 piece outfit is so fun and lightweight! Perfect for Florida weather as the material is super light and thin, but not see through. Extremely comfortable!
Felt like a cute little hippie chic in this top and matching buttons. Quarantine peace and love
Easy, lose fit. Wore with high-waisted jeans and sandals for a casual spring style. So fun, I wore this one several times!

links_reviews_title: Lovely draping, elegant, comfortable enough for all day
links_reviews_text: This was slinky and moved well, and was fairly forgiving. The neckline was simple yet classy. The door is a rich rust red that goes well with many shades like turquoise or taupe. It wore well for a business meeting and also church.

Rented this for an office holiday party, wore it to work all day and then to the event. Appropriate for both events, received so many compliments. The dress is stunning and hangs beautifully. It runs large -- i should have sized down but ran out of time to wait for the smaller size to become available.
Couldn't wear it to work because it was so huge. Would probably work better on someone with a longer torso as there was a lot of extra fabric on top.

This was actually a perfect little work dress, better if you move around a lot, not so good if you're sitting all day. The bottom button kept coming undone. I got several compliments on it and felt good wearing it. The material had just the right amount of give and it held its shape beautifully all day.
Reminds me of old fashion nurse's uniform. Fit well, good fabric.
Great material. Great for a more professional woman. I work at a school and it's on the fancy side. With that said, everyone made comments and compliments to me about what I was wearing here.
A little low cut but a safety pin fixed that and I got compliments all day. Great color.

links_reviews_title: The picture does not do it justice!!
links_reviews_text: This classic coat dress has serious Jackie O. vibes!! I will be renting this one over and over as I don’t think it will ever go out of style. The fabric is gorgeous and the fit is amazing!!!
So fun!
basic dress for work
Low cut, for a work setting -def wear with a tank top or cami-underneath.

I love the color of this dress especially for spring. It is somewhat of a body con fit which isn't necessarily my style, but this dress still felt very classy. Loved the long length and thicker, high-quality material. I am 5'11" and the sleeves were plenty long. I would imagine it would be difficult for a petite person to wear this dress.
The dress is really comfortable - great for date night with an eye-catching shoe. Sleeves are longer than in the picture but still easy to wear. I received a lot of compliments on the color.
Size down , the rib of the knit is large which gives more room but can also not fit appropriately

Love this tie dye and my favorite detail is the triangle pocket front. It's so unique. This is the ultimate porch button up for the summer. Throw on with shorts or over a bathing suit. So light weight but definitely runs large. If you don't want this look, size down.
Tie-dye and on trend! Light and airy & perfect for a spring or summer day. Fit is loose and comfy.
I sort of knew it would be from the picture but it's a very unisex size, don't rent this expecting it to be like a normal button up. I love the print and fabric, very breathable.
The fabric is lightweight and beyond cute, but this is a very boxy shirt. I wore it tucked into high waisted jeans and got loads of compliments.

Perfect jumpsuit for spring. Fabric is high quality and comfortable, though not very stretchy. I'm usually between a 2 and 4, and the 4 fit snuggly. If you're between sizes I recommend sizing up. This hugged perfectly in all the right places and very flattering. A fun outfit for quarantine!
Super fun summer design, was relapses you to get on and off which is always a plus when it comes to rompers or jumpsuits

links_reviews_title: Bright and cheery fabric. Fairly comfortable.
links_reviews_text: I love the cheery pattern to brighten up my quarantine days. The fit was not terribly flattering and it was a big pain to untie the tie in the back every time I needed to use the restroom.
The material was heavy and suffocating, like wearing hotel curtains.

I had high hopes that perhaps the first two reviews just weren't correct. I tried my best to make it work-the concept is great but the dress just looked soppy. The wrap isn't incredibly secure and the pockets make the fit awkward/unflattering.

links_reviews_title: Looks like an old man's bathrobe!
links_reviews_text: Rented this for work Cons: fit and length were great, the material was thick, and it wasn't too low cut as some wrap dresses are. Cons: the material is what I imagine a fancy old man wears to bed which the pattern doesn't help with. The thick material and way it wraps also makes it looks very much like a bathrobe. Also, the hole for the ribbon is pretty large so you could see my skin. Definitely a no for me.
Fit well and well-constructed. It made me realize I don't need a tan trench coat because the color isn't that complimentary with my skin tone.

I found the neck on the XS to be a bit funky (it kept twisting at a weird angle at the seam) and the sweater looked fairly worn / had seen better days. If it were newer in better condition, would have given it 5 stars, or more likely, bought it.
So many compliments, truly a staple great sweater!
Loved this! Great for a cold weekend.
stylish oversize sweater perfect for lounging around.
Casual but so comfy, nice fit - not too short, not too long, not too loose or snug, etc. This is bulky if you want to wear under a coat though - this made my coat tight in the sleeves.

I wore this sweater for Thanksgiving and to work (I am actually wearing it right now) and plan to send back this week. It is beyond warm and cozy and I wore it with velvet black pants, flats and an Anne Boleyn headband, for an 80s preppy look. It is slightly cropped, which is does not look like it is in the photo, so high waisted pants are a must. Otherwise, so nice!
Love love love. Xs was actually a little big. Neck is big and so are arms but it is so comfy and it fits in all the right places!

links_reviews_text: This top is very unique in an almost ugly way to me. I ended up really liking it though! It had a spring look but the mock turtle neck kept it warm for colder temps.
Adorable fun print and unique top. Received numerous compliments. Not itchy and just the right amount of warmth.

I really loved this sweater- it's actually sweatshirt material. I loved how the neck was fitted (not too tight either), and the unique pattern. I got a ton of compliments at work. It was long enough, which was nice. I thought it was black, but it's actually a deep navy.

I sized up based on reviews and overall I thought it was perfect, but the neck was higher than I thought it would be and was really tight. It probably wouldn't bother a normal person but I get claustrophobic when things are tight on my neck, so I didn't end up wearing it to work. I also wished it was a softer material, it felt a little too structured.
Boxy at top and high mock neck but shorter than average sweatshirt and tighter around hips. But good quality and recommend. Wore it two days in a row and got lots of compliments.
It's really cute but the fit is kind of awkward. It felt too small in some ways, but the right size in others. Just oddly made, for my body at least.

heavy/warm fabric, but not breathable. the print is gorgeous and has kind of a dolman fit in the sleeves. shorter waist than i expected but fit TTS.
Oh this rompers gets all of the hearts and stars! It's so comfortable and light weight but not see through. I put a black tank under for extra coverage. I'm a 36G.
Nice soft material, fits well and can belt for extra adjustment. Paired with turtle neck and super comfy!

PROS: I don't do rompers because they are such a pain to take off and put back on for restroom breaks. But this one looked so comfy and it's a great color. So I went with it. It really is so comfy. ALMOST bought it. CONS: It was just too much of a pain for restroom breaks. But for me that goes for all rompers. But if rompers are your thing. This one is great for staying home or running errands.

I rented this jumpsuit during the forced work from home quarantine and it's amazing. Super comfortable and cute - perfect for walking around in spring weather. Nice orangey color. Definitely on to something with work from home leisure fashion.

Color is cute too and b/c it's not Christmas-y or school-girl colors it doesn't look juvenile.
Comfy, airy, flashy but flexible. I wore something underneath most of the time but didn't need to. I would 100% buy this if it weren't so crazy expensive! Great for everyday or date style events!
